blog.name: peachyypotter
blog.title: mischief managed
blog.description:
aleena. hufflepuff. horned serpent. infj;a.

i stan charlie weasley and peter parker.

-school hiatus-

main/personal: sproutng

summary: ii. double-double fantasy [peter parker x witch! reader]
title: ii. double-double fantasy [peter parker x witch! reader]
body:
summary: the superhero world, besides their true identities, is and always has been public, however that’s not the same case for the wizarding world.
warnings: thoughts, emphasized words, and spells are in italics, minor swearing
word count: +1.2k
pov: 3rd person, reader
a/n: starting from the robbery scene! also, i got the wand placement idea from mission impossible: fallout fjakifqiao i was so Gay when i saw that i’m gay all the time but whatever. comments/likes/rb are appreciated!
fun fact from the wiki! at ilvermorny school of witchcraft and wizardry, the sorting ceremony couldn’t be anymore different from hogwarts’. the student stands on a celtic gordian knot surrounded by four statues representing the four houses. a statue will respond accordingly: the crystal in the horned serpent’s forehead glows, wampus roars, the thunderbird’s wings beat, and the pukwudgie raises its arrow. somewhat similar to a hatstall at hogwarts, a student can be picked by more than one house, in which they get to choose out of two, most often. there has only been a few to have had all four to choose from, and one is seraphina picquery, the president of MACUSA from 1920-28. she chose horned serpent. sorry it’s long i get so excited about ilvermorny

teaser | part 1 | part 2 | part 3

(y/n) ducked down but kept watch from the wide window. she heard peter’s footsteps behind her dart away. was he running away?, she thought. she wouldn’t blame him if he was. she stared intently at the store, looking for the thieves. they were wearing robes, meaning they were wizards, like her. well, she was technically a witch, but that’s besides the point. who else would wear robes in the middle of queens?

the newly-graduated witch saw the wizards about to leave the store with their mischievous smiles. she took a quick glance over her shoulder to confirm that peter wasn’t watching and got up. but suddenly, a man in a red suit with web designs and a silver spider on the chest whisked in. he landed in front of the thieves just as they exited.

the sound was muffled because of the barrier, but she heard him shout, “stop right there!”

the criminals shared a look with each other and laughed. mockingly, one replied, “what’s a guy in a tight red suit gonna do, huh?”

okay, hopefully this spider-guy, or whoever he was, has some tricks up his sleeve. if not, then she’ll take it over and probably obliviate him. the american wizarding world was not so accepting of no-maj’s knowing about wizards, but the no-maj’s sure are okay about a god of thunder running around along with other enhanced heroes. she didn’t wanna find out what the MACUSA would say about a superhero finding out about wizards as some were still considered mortal. hopefully, the criminals would get the punishment and not her.

it would definitely ruin (y/n)’s chances of becoming an auror for the magical government if any no-maj found out about her. peter was definitely one of those problems, and she sighed as she witnessed the spider-guy say something and then spin around, shooting webs and tying up the wizards.

it was definitely a sight to behold, and it definitely would have worked. if the opponents weren’t wizards. the spider-guy put his hands on his hips as if admiring his handiwork, and (y/n) let out a sigh. 

yeah, she had to handle this herself. she pushed herself out the door as one of the wizards cut themselves out of the spiderwebs. “diffindo!” he had shouted. they turned to grin at the arachnid-like guy whose slits for eyes widened mechanically in surprise.

“not so tough now, spider-boy?” the other taunted.

taking her wand out from the pantyhose lace that stopped at her thigh and underneath her dress, she pointed it at the pair. “expelliarmus!”

the wands they held were flung towards her, and she caught them easily. she wasn’t ilvermorny’s dueling champion for nothing.

“what’s a witch doing in queens?” one sneered at her.

“i don’t have to answer to you,” she answered coldly before pointing her wand at them again. “depulso! confringo!”

they were pushed by the spells towards the walls. their heads were hit as they let out groans and fainted. the spider-guy stood still as if shocked. she walked towards him, ready to perform the obliviate charm on the superhero.

“you should tie them up, just in case. this is a wizard matter, not a no-maj one. i’ll notify our government and clean this up, but you have to forget this,” (y/n) told him.

“what?! why?” a familiar voice asked from under the mask as the slits moved in response to his own expression.

her eyebrows furrowed, and her eyes narrowed in suspicion. “your voice sounds familiar, do i know you?”

the eyes of the mask opened wide, and the familiar stranger shook his head in fear. she took a few steps towards him, ready to uncover his disguise. he took a few steps back in response. right before she could grab at the mask, the spider-guy flung himself away with webs faster than she could react and cast a spell. “hey!” she shouted after him as he disappeared into the city.

“merlin… i hope the MACUSA doesn’t find out…” she whispered to herself as she walked over to deal with the fainted criminals. using her gift in transfiguration, she transformed the broken rocks into small vials.

“let’s turn you into little insects, shall we?” (y/n) asked, mostly to herself. for your average wizard, yes, it’s quite difficult to transfigure someone else. however, (y/n) wasn’t the average witch. she graduated at the top of her class for a reason and had won several excellence awards at ilvermorny. one of them happened to be for transfiguration. with a wave of her wand, one man turned into a beetle, and the smaller one a ladybug. 

she placed them into the vials and made holes at the top for air. but wasn’t there something else she had to…? peter. shit, she thought to herself as her (e/c) eyes widened.

there was no way (y/n) could hand the criminals over to the magical government without ditching peter. and that was something she didn’t wanna do. pocketing the vials and her wand in her pantyhose, she left the mess and ran to the cafe. she ducked under the table they were at previously as to not raise suspicion.

peter darted out of the bathroom, panting a little. “(y/n)? are you okay? i called the police, and they should be here.”

she peeked from her hiding place and lied between her teeth. “yeah, i’m okay… the criminals already escaped though.”

his brown eyes narrowed a little as if to judge her, but they quickly returned to normal. peter approached the table and lent out a hand to help her out. she took it, and he pulled her up with surprising strength. something clicked in her mind. “let’s get you home then,” he told her with a smile.

“yeah, that would be great. it’s been a long day,” (y/n) said to him. they walked out of the store, peter holding the door for her. he didn’t close it and leave, but turned to shout something.

“hey, sal! thanks for letting us stay! we’ll be leaving now!” another click. she knew that voice.

“alright, peter! you get home safely!” the owner shouted back.

“will do!” and he closed the door and nodded to her. she stood, not moving as he walked away. he noticed and turned around to look at her. his eyebrows were raised. “(y/n), is something wrong?”

“peter… you wouldn’t lie to me right?” she hesitantly said. she looked up at him slowly.

“i wouldn’t. what’s wrong?” he asked curiously.

“are you… that spider superhero?”

his face froze as his eyes widened and looked at her. his lips tried to form words before he gulped and started to speak, “then, are you… a witch?”

“peter, we need to talk.” he nodded. “somewhere private. and now.”

(y/n) stepped towards him and grabbed his hand. she knew she shouldn’t be doing this, but this was an emergency. “sorry,” she apologized in advance.

“why are y—“ he started to ask, and that is when she apparated them to her apartment. “WHOA!” peter stumbled a little and fell on his bottom. “that’s why you were—“ 

she answered with a nod. she was glad he was still the same peter with his easily excited personality in these sort of situations. “have a seat, pete. we have a lot of explaining to do.”

“yeah, we do, (y/n/n).”

series masterlist

a/n: starting from the robbery scene! also, i got the wand placement idea from mission impossible: fallout fjakifqiao i was so Gay when i saw that i’m gay all the time but whatever. comments/likes/rb are appreciated!

the criminals shared a look with each other and laughed. mockingly, one replied, “what’s a guy in a tight red suit gonna do, huh?”

okay, hopefully this spider-guy, or whoever he was, has some tricks up his sleeve. if not, then she’ll take it over and probably obliviate him. the american wizarding world was not so accepting of no-maj’s knowing about wizards, but the no-maj’s sure are okay about a god of thunder running around along with other enhanced heroes. she didn’t wanna find out what the MACUSA would say about a superhero finding out about wizards as some were still considered mortal. hopefully, the criminals would get the punishment and not her.

it would definitely ruin (y/n)’s chances of becoming an auror for the magical government if any no-maj found out about her. peter was definitely one of those problems, and she sighed as she witnessed the spider-guy say something and then spin around, shooting webs and tying up the wizards.

it was definitely a sight to behold, and it definitely would have worked. if the opponents weren’t wizards. the spider-guy put his hands on his hips as if admiring his handiwork, and (y/n) let out a sigh. 

yeah, she had to handle this herself. she pushed herself out the door as one of the wizards cut themselves out of the spiderwebs. “diffindo!” he had shouted. they turned to grin at the arachnid-like guy whose slits for eyes widened mechanically in surprise.

“not so tough now, spider-boy?” the other taunted.

taking her wand out from the pantyhose lace that stopped at her thigh and underneath her dress, she pointed it at the pair. “expelliarmus!”

the wands they held were flung towards her, and she caught them easily. she wasn’t ilvermorny’s dueling champion for nothing.

“what’s a witch doing in queens?” one sneered at her.

“i don’t have to answer to you,” she answered coldly before pointing her wand at them again. “depulso! confringo!”

they were pushed by the spells towards the walls. their heads were hit as they let out groans and fainted. the spider-guy stood still as if shocked. she walked towards him, ready to perform the obliviate charm on the superhero.

“you should tie them up, just in case. this is a wizard matter, not a no-maj one. i’ll notify our government and clean this up, but you have to forget this,” (y/n) told him.

“what?! why?” a familiar voice asked from under the mask as the slits moved in response to his own expression.

her eyebrows furrowed, and her eyes narrowed in suspicion. “your voice sounds familiar, do i know you?”

the eyes of the mask opened wide, and the familiar stranger shook his head in fear. she took a few steps towards him, ready to uncover his disguise. he took a few steps back in response. right before she could grab at the mask, the spider-guy flung himself away with webs faster than she could react and cast a spell. “hey!” she shouted after him as he disappeared into the city.

“merlin… i hope the MACUSA doesn’t find out…” she whispered to herself as she walked over to deal with the fainted criminals. using her gift in transfiguration, she transformed the broken rocks into small vials.

“let’s turn you into little insects, shall we?” (y/n) asked, mostly to herself. for your average wizard, yes, it’s quite difficult to transfigure someone else. however, (y/n) wasn’t the average witch. she graduated at the top of her class for a reason and had won several excellence awards at ilvermorny. one of them happened to be for transfiguration. with a wave of her wand, one man turned into a beetle, and the smaller one a ladybug. 

she placed them into the vials and made holes at the top for air. but wasn’t there something else she had to…? peter. shit, she thought to herself as her (e/c) eyes widened.

there was no way (y/n) could hand the criminals over to the magical government without ditching peter. and that was something she didn’t wanna do. pocketing the vials and her wand in her pantyhose, she left the mess and ran to the cafe. she ducked under the table they were at previously as to not raise suspicion.

peter darted out of the bathroom, panting a little. “(y/n)? are you okay? i called the police, and they should be here.”

she peeked from her hiding place and lied between her teeth. “yeah, i’m okay… the criminals already escaped though.”

his brown eyes narrowed a little as if to judge her, but they quickly returned to normal. peter approached the table and lent out a hand to help her out. she took it, and he pulled her up with surprising strength. something clicked in her mind. “let’s get you home then,” he told her with a smile.

“yeah, that would be great. it’s been a long day,” (y/n) said to him. they walked out of the store, peter holding the door for her. he didn’t close it and leave, but turned to shout something.

“hey, sal! thanks for letting us stay! we’ll be leaving now!” another click. she knew that voice.

“alright, peter! you get home safely!” the owner shouted back.

“will do!” and he closed the door and nodded to her. she stood, not moving as he walked away. he noticed and turned around to look at her. his eyebrows were raised. “(y/n), is something wrong?”

“peter… you wouldn’t lie to me right?” she hesitantly said. she looked up at him slowly.

“i wouldn’t. what’s wrong?” he asked curiously.

“are you… that spider superhero?”

his face froze as his eyes widened and looked at her. his lips tried to form words before he gulped and started to speak, “then, are you… a witch?”

“peter, we need to talk.” he nodded. “somewhere private. and now.”

(y/n) stepped towards him and grabbed his hand. she knew she shouldn’t be doing this, but this was an emergency. “sorry,” she apologized in advance.

“why are y—“ he started to ask, and that is when she apparated them to her apartment. “WHOA!” peter stumbled a little and fell on his bottom. “that’s why you were—“ 

she answered with a nod. she was glad he was still the same peter with his easily excited personality in these sort of situations. “have a seat, pete. we have a lot of explaining to do.”

“yeah, we do, (y/n/n).”

trail.content_abstract:
summary: the superhero world, besides their true identities, is and always has been public, however that’s not the same case for the wizarding world.
warnings: thoughts, emphasized words, and spells are in italics, minor swearing
word count: +1.2k
pov: 3rd person, reader
a/n: starting from the robbery scene! also, i got the wand placement idea from mission impossible: fallout fjakifqiao i was so Gay when i saw that i’m gay all the time but whatever. comments/likes/rb are appreciated!
fun fact from the wiki! at ilvermorny school of witchcraft and wizardry, the sorting ceremony couldn’t be anymore different from hogwarts’. the student stands on a celtic gordian knot surrounded by four statues representing the four houses. a statue will respond accordingly: the crystal in the horned serpent’s forehead glows, wampus roars, the thunderbird’s wings beat, and the pukwudgie raises its arrow. somewhat similar to a hatstall at hogwarts, a student can be picked by more than one house, in which they get to choose out of two, most often. there has only been a few to have had all four to choose from, and one is seraphina picquery, the president of MACUSA from 1920-28. she chose horned serpent. sorry it’s long i get so excited about ilvermorny

teaser | part 1 | part 2 | part 3

(y/n) ducked down but kept watch from the wide window. she heard peter’s footsteps behind her dart away. was he running away?, she thought. she wouldn’t blame him if he was. she stared intently at the store, looking for the thieves. they were wearing robes, meaning they were wizards, like her. well, she was technically a witch, but that’s besides the point. who else would wear robes in the middle of queens?

the newly-graduated witch saw the wizards about to leave the store with their mischievous smiles. she took a quick glance over her shoulder to confirm that peter wasn’t watching and got up. but suddenly, a man in a red suit with web designs and a silver spider on the chest whisked in. he landed in front of the thieves just as they exited.

the sound was muffled because of the barrier, but she heard him shout, “stop right there!”

body:
Airport footage

I wonder if the BTS video from FFH is Peter returning to NY from abroad or if it’s Aunt May coming to wherever Peter is after something happens.

Definitely seemed like a more relieved reunion than a happy one (kind of like the hug HOCO when he returned from D.C)


EDIT: Sources are saying the airport was made to look like Newark Airport (NJ) and that Zendaya was also there filming even though she isn’t seen in the footage.

body:
Spider-Man homecoming

I find it funny that people think that aunt may at the end of the movie would think peters spider man. Like he’s a tiny nerdy little dude. Why would she suspect that he spider man? She’d just think that it’s like a really good cosplay suit and be like “awe sweety that looks so good!”


So really what I’m saying is that when she said wtf she was suprised that he had a whole ducking suit without her even noticing, or that she thought Spider-Man was in her house until Peter turns around and she goes “oooh you’re just doing that cosplay thing?”
